DOC.brief_summary: Traumatic skin lesions and in particular the burns which happen to growing children are complex and require an adapted and early patient care management. A child presents physical, psychological, and physiological characteristics which involve a specific functional prognosis. The aim of the study was to evaluate the functional outcome after a mid-term period from a severe skin traumatism occurring during childhood and which had required an initial graft.
DOC.brief_title: Children Severe Traumatic Skin Lesions and Functional Outcome
DOC.criteria: children who were hospitalized for an extensive and deep skin lesion on at least one joint, at CHU Amiens, from April 1999 to December 2014, in the Physical and Rehabilitation Pediatric activity center.
